stories.title: Linux Kernel 7.0 Released with Major Performance Improvements
stories.short_summary: The Linux Foundation has announced the release of Linux Kernel 7.0, featuring significant performance improvements across multiple architectures. The new kernel includes enhanced scheduling algorithms and reduced memory overhead for containerized workloads.
talking_points: New CFS scheduler reduces context switch overhead by 15%
Memory management improvements reduce RSS for container workloads
Rust driver support expanded to cover USB and network subsystems
stories.quote: This is the most significant kernel release in years.

perspectives.text: The container optimizations could reduce cloud costs by 5-10% for large-scale deployments.
Expanded Rust support signals a long-term commitment to memory safety in the kernel.

articles.title: Linux Kernel 7.0 Arrives with Container Optimizations
Linux Kernel 7.0 Boosts Rust Driver Support

stories.title: Firefox 140 Introduces Tab Grouping and Vertical Tabs
stories.short_summary: Mozilla has released Firefox 140, bringing long-requested tab grouping and vertical tab features to the stable channel. The update also includes performance improvements for JavaScript-heavy web applications.
talking_points: Tab groups can be collapsed and color-coded
Vertical tabs available as a built-in sidebar option
SpiderMonkey JIT improvements show 8% faster page loads

articles.title: Mozilla Adds Vertical Tabs to Firefox
